revision.text:
{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = TL-WN722N-01.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = 150Mbps High Gain Wireless USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = TP-LINK_TL-WN722N_v1.x |wikipedia = |brand = TP-LINK |model = TL-WN722N |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = v1.x |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |sernum = |wlclass = N150 |series = TL-WN722N |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = dongle |vendor_id = 0cf3 |device_id = 9271 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = TE7WN722N |icid = |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = D8:5D:4C, E8:94:F6 |chip1 = Atheros;AR9271L;AR9271L-AL3A, D3E103C, 1236, KOREA; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = RP-SMA |antenna = |txchains = 1 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 1 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |802.11n = 150 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |wififreq = 2.4 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 11/18/2009 |estreldate = |price = |upc = 845973050467 |ean = 6935364050467 |asin = B002SZEOLG |asin_country = US |asin2 = B002WBX9C6 |asin_country2 = CA |multirev = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== The [[TP-LINK TL-WN722NC]] is this adapter with an included cradle. "11n High-gain USB Adapter-6 (AR) A" and "REV: 1.0" is silkscreened :on the board in the [https://fccid.io/document.php?id=1200885 FCC photos] (PCB v1.0 [[Atheros AR9271]]-AL1E) Known at least two EAN numbers: 6935364050467 and 6935364090432 :1T1R SISO, 4dBi detachable Omni Directional antenna (RP-SMA conn.) {{WiFiCert|WFA8529|01/11/2010}} ==Links of Interest== :[http://www.tp-link.us/products/details/TL-WN722N.html Product page] (TL-WN722N) {{â€¢}} [http://www.tp-link.us/products/details/TL-WN722NC.html Product page] (TL-WN722NC) ==Pictures==
'''Retail Images''' File:TL-WN722N-01.jpg|TP-WN722N adapter File:TL-WN722N 1.0-P1.jpg|TP-WN722N box File:TL-WN722NC-01.jpg|TP-WN722NC in cradle File:TL-WN722NC 1.0-P1.jpg|TP-WN722NC box
[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]][[Has images::packaging| ]]
'''User Images''' File:TP-LINK TL-WN722N top.jpg|top File:TP-LINK TL-WN722N bot.jpg|bottom [[Has images::external| ]][[Has images::label| ]] File:TL-WN722N-front a.jpg|PCB v1.1 front File:TL-WN722N-front b.jpg|AR9271L-AL3A File:TL-WN722N-back.jpg|PCB v1.1 back
[[Has images::internal| ]] ==Notes== ===Versions=== * Version 1.10 has been seen printed on the box but is still the same chipset. :"2052500328" and "REV: 1.1" is silkscreened on the board (PCB Version 1.1) * Product Version 1.10 (on the box) with PCB Version 1.2 has been seen but :is still the same chipset (minor layout differences vs. PCB Version 1.1) * Version 2.x is using [[Realtek]] RTL8188EUS chip. See [[TP-LINK TL-WN722N v2]]. * Version 3.x is using [[Realtek]] RTL8188EUS chip. It is a rebadged v2. ===FCC test results=== * Radiated power (with antenna): 98.72 dBuV/m peak (802.11b CH6) * Output power (before antenna): 17.8 dBm peak (802.11b CH6) (60.26mW) ===Additional info=== * This device supports a maximum of [[Maximum supported AP VIFs w/ Linux driver::2]] simultaneous AP and 7 clients VIFs w/ '''[[ath9k_htc]]''' * Output of '''sudo lsusb -v -d 0cf3:9271''' [http://pastebin.com/6dSSvTUP here], or [https://cloud.openmailbox.org/public.php?service=files&t=43d6e8c20ed4f3391e7e7dd5be6e6f24&download here]. {{SCollapse|lsusb output |

firmware-atheros_0.43~bpo70+1 (htc_9271.fw v1.3)

Wiphy phy0
	Band 1:
		Capabilities: 0x116e
			HT20/HT40
			SM Power Save disabled
			RX HT20 SGI
			RX HT40 SGI
			RX STBC 1-stream
			Max AMSDU length: 3839 bytes
			DSSS/CCK HT40
		Maximum RX AMPDU length 65535 bytes (exponent: 0x003)

		HT TX/RX MCS rate indexes supported: 0-7
		Frequencies:
			* 2412 MHz [1] (20.0 dBm)
			* 2417 MHz [2] (20.0 dBm)

		* CCMP (00-0f-ac:4)
		* CMAC (00-0f-ac:6)

		 * IBSS

		 * monitor
		 * mesh point
		 * P2P-client

		   total <= 2, #channels <= 1

		 * Unknown command (89)
		 * Unknown command (92)

		 * disconnect

		 * IBSS: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * managed: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * AP: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
		 * AP/VLAN: 0x00 0x10 0x20 0x30 0x40 0x50 0x60 0x70 0x80 0x90 0xa0 0xb0 0xc0 0xd0 0xe0 0xf0
